Package sparta.clack.cipher

Class CaesarCipher

java.lang.Object
sparta.clack.cipher.CharacterCipher
sparta.clack.cipher.CaesarCipher
public class CaesarCipher extends CharacterCipher
The CaesarCipher class implements encryption and decryption using the Caesar cipher technique.

The Caesar cipher is a substitution cipher where each letter in the plaintext is shifted a fixed number of places down or up the alphabet. This class provides methods for both encryption and decryption based on this technique.

  • Constructor Details

    • CaesarCipher

      public CaesarCipher(int key)
      Constructs a CaesarCipher with the specified key and the default alphabet.
      Parameters:
      key - the number of positions each letter in the plaintext is shifted. This value is modulo the length of the alphabet to ensure it falls within the valid range.

    • CaesarCipher

      public CaesarCipher(String key)
      Constructs a CaesarCipher where the shift is given by taking the key's first letter, then finding the location of this letter in ALPHABET.
      Parameters:
      key - the string whose first letter determines the shift.
